message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.DC, cs.MM

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on mobile edge computing and communication resource allocation in a three-node MEC system, which falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture.
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The use of non-orthogonal multiple access (NOMA) in the proposed scheme involves information theory concepts such as channel coding and decoding, which makes cs.IT a likely sub-category.
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The optimization problems studied in the paper involve joint communication and computation resource allocation, which can be viewed as a control problem. Therefore, cs.SY is a possible sub-category.
4. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper proposes a cooperative computing scheme where mobile devices can offload computation tasks to nearby devices, which involves distributed computing concepts. Hence, cs.DC is a possible sub-category.
5. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper presents simulation results to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed scheme, which involves multimedia data transmission and processing. Therefore, cs.MM is a possible sub-category.
